newsitem.title: USA: Clinton heads back to Washington to work on budget.
newsitem.headline: Clinton heads back to Washington to work on budget.

text.p: President Clinton said farewell Monday to a summit on volunteer work by saying he was going back to work on trying to reach a budget deal with Congress.
"I'm going back to Washington today to try to conclude our budget negotiations within the next, I don't know, two days," adding quickly, "Two months, two years."
Asked by reporters afterward if he really expected a deal in the next two days, he pointed out that he had left his options open.
"We're not on a timeline," he said, "but I'm going back to do some work on it."
